title: What are the information sources found in the library, and what are they used for? - Quora

response.answer_text: I could probably write a book on the different information sources libraries contain and their uses. However, here is a brief summary of what types of information most libraries contain. Keep in mind that different types of libraries have different types of information. A public library will have different information sources than a college library. In general, most libraries have the same general types of information. Print sources: This can be popular reading books, reference books, books published by experts, dissertations, newspapers, magazines, government information.Electronic sources: These can include e-books, electronic databases, guides and tutorials, and other web-based sources of information. A library catalog is typically kept online in its own electronic platform.Electronic databases contain multiple types of information sources. They can contain e-books, academic journals, dissertations, conference papers, newspapers, financial reports, etc.Reference librarians: These are people who have obtained professional degrees to help people find information that is credible and relevant to the user’s needs.Miscellaneous: Many public libraries allow users to check out “things” to meet community needs. Some libraries offer ties the public can check out for job interviews. Libraries that offer these types of items are often found in low-income communities. Some libraries offer cooking supplies for people who are interesting in learning specialty cooking skills such as cake pans, mixers, etc. Some have electronics the public can check out such as laptops and iPads.Every library is different in the types of information sources they contain because every library community is different and has different needs.

Information sources are carrier of information. In general information sources can be divided into three Primary Information sources: these are first hand source of information narrated by see witnesses, examples are memoir, dairies, daily newspapers, autobiographies, etc. Secondary Information Sources: these are edited primary sources of information, they contain explanation, detail descriptions, analysis of primary sources. example textbooks. Hoverever, some authors argue that secondary sources are pointers to tertiary sources, such as abstracts, bibliography, indexes etc. Tertiary Information Sources: these are well organized sources of information in either, chronological, alphabetical, or numerical order for easy retrieval. examples are the reference materials: dictionary, encyclopedia, compendium etc. Yes, all these information sources can be found in library. Users information needs will determine the use of all these information sources. in summary. the information sources are used to satisfy information need.
